title: 'They all hate each other': Navarro's latest attack on India, China; 'vampire' dig at Brics
description: Peter Navarro, former trade advisor to Donald Trump, has launched a tirade against BRICS nations, accusing them of being "vampires" dependent on trade with the United States. He claimed internal conflicts and economic woes plague the alliance, citing tensions between Russia and China, India and China, and Brazil's economic struggles.

title: New menus and restaurants to try out in Bengaluru this week
description: Swanky new bars, microbreweries, and restaurants upping their game with new menus. September marks an interesting start for Bengaluru’s culinary world, and here are the highlights

title: India-China: the need for a border settlement
description: Special Representatives were appointed by both nations, proposed by Prime Minister Vajpayee, solely for the purpose of settling the border issue. However, even now, a decade later, the boundary remains as indeterminate as ever

title: How does two-factor authentication (2FA) work?
description: The idea of 2FA is that you prove your identity in two different ways. The first factor is something you know: your password. The second factor is something you have: an authenticator app running on your phone

title: Lachlan Murdoch cements control of Fox, WSJ media empire in new family deal
description: The deal ends a family brawl over who will control one of the highest-profile global media groups and puts to rest questions of succession within the Murdoch family

description: C.P. Radhakrishnan, backed by the NDA, holds the edge over INDIA bloc’s Justice B. Sudershan Reddy; PM Modi will cast the first vote

title: Delhi Lok Adalat on September 13: How to settle and waive off traffic challans
'Disrespect kar sakti thi’: Dhanashree breaks silence, hits out at ex-husband Yuzvendra
description: Choreographer Dhanashree Verma’s separation from Indian cricketer Yuzvendra Chahal has remained one of the most talked-about controversies of the year. Since the divorce, she has been subjected to relentless trolling, with many unfairly branding her a “gold digger.” Now seen on the reality show Rise And Fall, Dhanashree has spoken candidly about her marriage, the backlash she has faced, and how she has chosen dignity over negativity. She also took subtle digs at both Chahal and the trolls during a recent task on the show.

description: Structured senior care is now being seen not as giving up, but as stepping up and ensuring elders receive the professional, round-the-clock support they need and deserve

title: Impostor in naval uniform: Guard duped; Rifle, 40 rounds vanish
description: A security breach occurred in Mumbai's Navy Nagar. An unidentified man impersonating a naval officer stole an INSAS rifle. He also took two magazines with 40 live cartridges. The incident happened last Saturday. Cuffe Parade police registered a theft case. Multiple agencies like NIA and ATS are investigating. The Navy has initiated a search and inquiry.

FIDE Grand Swiss: Gukesh stunned by Abhimanyu ; Praggnanandhaa falls to Bluebaum
description: Top seed Grandmaster R Praggnanandhaa suffered a shock defeat at the hands of Germany’s Matthias Bluebaum, while reigning World Champion D Gukesh went down to Abhimanyu Mishra of the USA — the youngest Grandmaster in chess history — in the fifth round of the FIDE Grand Swiss on Monday.

title: Trump administration launches immigration raids in Chicago
description: The Illinois governor said no advance notice or coordination was provided; critics decry 'Operation Midway Blitz' as political theater

title: Why Wuthering Heights is not a romance. The misreading of Emily Brontë’s classic
As India steps up GCC play, the increasing trade-off with IT services exports has policymakers concerned
Global land at risk? Scientists raise alarm; warns 60% beyond ecological limits
description: A recent study reveals that human activities have pushed 60% of Earth's land outside the safe operating zone, threatening ecosystems. Deforestation, agriculture, and industrial expansion have disrupted carbon, water, and nitrogen cycles, particularly in Europe, Asia, and North America. Scientists urge immediate global action to protect natural systems and prevent irreversible damage to food security, water supplies, and the climate.

title: AAP J&K MLA arrest: Opp parties say use of PSA ‘undemocratic’, BJP welcomes action against ‘repeat offender’
Caleb Williams’ breakup shock: NFL star splits with Alina Thyregod
description: Footballer Caleb Williams, known for his college success, faced public attention in his personal life. His relationship with Alina Thyregod ended. Williams was later seen with actress Madelyn Cline. This happened after his initial NFL season. Williams' journey shows the challenges of fame. His career and relationships are now under scrutiny. Fans are keenly observing his life.

title: West Bengal Governor and Chief Minister shower Bengali filmmaker Anuparna Roy with appreciation for Venice win
description: The Purulia born Bengali director gained praise for making history at a global platform

title: Asia Cup: Lucky charm or superstition? Gautam Gambhir spotted with KKR bag
description: Outside the ICC Academy ground in Dubai, Gautam Gambhir was also seen interacting warmly with supporters and signing autographs, further adding to the excitement building around India’s preparations. His popularity, both as a former player and now as a coach, continues to resonate strongly with fans.

title: Kharge chides farmer hit by flood, BJP says conduct 'arrogant'
description: India's BJP and its allies have strongly criticized Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge for his alleged arrogant behavior towards a distressed farmer in Karnataka, as seen in a viral video. They also slammed Rahul Gandhi for his reported foreign trip amidst farmer distress in flood-hit regions.

Trump had denied authoring the note and drawing, dismissing it as false. The release coincides with congressional pressure for transparency on Epstein-related documents, as lawmakers seek further investigation into the matter.

Bengaluru’s Blue Line of Namma Metro scheduled for completion by Dec. 2027
description: According to Bangalore Metro Rail Corporation Limited, once completed, the Blue Line will form a 58.19-km uninterrupted corridor connecting Silk Board Junction in the south with the airport in the north via K.R. Pura.

title: ‘Fake medicine racket’ busted operating from Agra and Lucknow, 4 held
Tank Bigsby: Eagles’ young RB; Saquon Barkley’s backup — plan revealed
description: The Philadelphia Eagles have acquired running back Tank Bigsby from the Jacksonville Jaguars just before Week 1 of the 2025 NFL season. Bigsby, a former Auburn standout, aims to bolster the Eagles' backfield depth behind Saquon Barkley. The Eagles also signed wide receiver John Metchie III, quarterback Sam Howell, and offensive tackles Fred Johnson and Darian Kennard.

title: Delhi L-G defamation case: Medha Patkar withdraws plea in SC
‘The Bengal Files’ box office collection: Film drops to Rs 1.10 cr post weekend
description: Vivek Agnihotri's 'The Bengal Files' has released amidst controversy. The film clashed with 'Baaghi 4' and 'The Conjuring: Last Rites'. It earned Rs 1.10 crore on Monday, bringing its total to Rs 7.85 crore. The film depicts the communal violence in Bengal during the 1940s. The cast includes Mithun Chakraborty, Anupam Kher and Pallavi Joshi.

Are new neurons born in the adult human brain? Study revives debate
description: Amid a morass of conflicting studies, new research — from researchers at the Karolinska Institutet in Stockholm — has provided further evidence for adult neurogenesis using modern sequencing and machine-learning methods, infusing new life into a long-standing debate with important scientific and practical implications

title: TANSACS to outsource recruitment of counsellors, lab technicians; employees protest

77,539 killed in two-wheeler crashes; riders most at risk: Govt report
description: In 2023, two-wheeler riders accounted for the highest share of road deaths in India, with 45% of fatalities. Accidents involving these vehicles also significantly impacted vulnerable road users, including pedestrians and cyclists.

title: 264 malaria cases in Delhi so far — highest in five years for January-Sept period
'He is so jealous’: Navratilova slams Trump; skips Alcaraz US Open celebration
description: Carlos Alcaraz secured his second US Open title in 2025, defeating Jannik Sinner in four sets and reclaiming the world No. 1 ranking. The victory was marked by former President Trump's attendance and apparent lack of applause, drawing criticism from Martina Navratilova. Alcaraz, now aiming for a Career Grand Slam, celebrated his best tournament performance.

HC: Treat arrest, even without exchange of fire, as encounter
description: The Punjab and Haryana High Court has ruled that apprehending armed militants qualifies as an "encounter" for reservation benefits for police personnel's children. Justice Jagmohan Bansal's order favored Sonam Kamboj, whose application was initially rejected because her father's service record did not meet the encounter participation criteria.

title: Accept Aadhaar as voter ID proof, SC directs EC
description: The Supreme Court has directed the Election Commission to accept Aadhaar cards as a valid proof of identity for voter list inclusion in Bihar, adding it as the 12th accepted document. This decision comes after the EC's initial resistance, with concerns raised about potential inclusion of illegal migrants.

title: West Bengal BJP holds protests over burning of Rabindranath Tagore’s photograph by TMCP cadres
description: A video posted by several leaders of the BJP on social media showed Trinamool Congress Chattra Parishad students under leadership of Chanchal College president of the student outfit A.B. Soyel attempting to burn a photograph of the poet along with Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Home Minister Amit Shah.

VP polls: Radhakrishnan vs Reddy - What’s happened so far, who has edge?
description: The vice-presidential election is scheduled for Tuesday, with NDA nominee CP Radhakrishnan expected to win against opposition candidate B Sudershan Reddy. NDA's strong majority in the electoral college, along with support from other parties, positions Radhakrishnan for a comfortable victory. Polling will occur in Parliament, and the results are anticipated late in the evening, marking a significant political event.

title: ‘US has long benefitted’: China on 50% tariffs on India; calls them ‘unfair'
description: Chinese Ambassador Xu Feihong advocated for stronger Sino-Indian ties, denouncing "unilateralism and bullying" and inviting Indian companies to invest in China, while seeking a fair business environment in India for Chinese firms. He criticized US tariffs and affirmed that Sino-Indian relations remain unaffected by third parties.

title: Kajal Aggarwal responds to road accident death hoax: ‘I am perfectly fine’
description: Kajal Aggarwal, one of the most popular actresses in the South who has also made her mark in Bollywood, became the target of a shocking death hoax after reports claimed she had passed away in a road accident. The rumours spread rapidly on social media, forcing the actress to step in and put an end to the speculation.

title: Meet Rohit Kumar, a Delhi labourer, finishes 2nd in Spiti marathon
description: Rohit Kumar, a daily wage labourer from Delhi, defies odds by excelling in marathons. Despite financial constraints after his medical studies in Russia were cut short, the 32-year-old has achieved podium finishes in multiple races, including a recent high-altitude marathon in Spiti.

title: Supreme Court asks Madhya Pradesh government to pay ₹25 lakh to convict for over 4 years in jail beyond term
description: Sohan Singh Yadav was only released from Sagar Central Jail on June 6 this year, after advocate Mahfooz A. Nazki wrote to the prison authorities and the M.P. State Legal Services Authority flagging the matter

title: Indian Army PARA (SF) and Indian Navy MARCOS conduct high-altitude combat diving training in Sikkim
description: “Training in these extreme conditions tests every aspect of a soldier’s endurance, skill and mental strength,” the Team Commander said

title: ‘Why should IO call autopsy doctor so many times’: Calcutta HC questions official’s role in BJP workers’ death
3 former BJP, AGP MLAs join Congress ahead of Assam Assembly polls
description: Former BJP MLAs Binanda Saikia and Mansingh Rongpi, and AGP MLA Satyabrata Kalita, were inducted into the party in the presence of senior leaders, including Assam Congress chief Gaurav Gogoi

title: A hundred years ago | British Communists: Drastic Police Action Proposed
Mumbai airport 'theft': 15 MIAL staff fired for taking seized coconuts, oil bottles
description: Over fifteen senior officials at Mumbai International Airport Ltd (MIAL) were forced to resign after being caught on CCTV taking confiscated security-restricted articles (SRA) for personal use. These items, including oil bottles and coconuts, are collected from passengers during security checks.

title: Teacher who made girl do 100 squats sacked, booked
description: In Chhattisgarh's Surguja district, a DAV Public School teacher was fired after severely punishing an eight-year-old student. The teacher forced the class 2 girl to do 100 squats and beat her with a stick, causing serious leg injuries. Police have filed a case against her under BNS and the Juvenile Justice Act.

title: In most states, majority of girls marry after 18, says government report
description: The SRS statistical report 2023 indicates a slight increase in the mean age at effective marriage for females in India, reaching 22.9 years. While most states see girls marrying after 18, West Bengal, Jharkhand, and Chhattisgarh still have notable instances of child marriage. Significant rural-urban disparities persist, with rural areas reporting a mean age of 22.4 years compared to 24.

title: Democrats release suggestive birthday letter to Epstein purportedly signed by Trump, which he denies
description: Donald Trump has denied writing the letter and creating the drawing, calling a report on it “false, malicious, and defamatory”

title: Ukrainian president Zelenskyy sees US tariffs on India as ‘right idea’
description: Amidst US-India tariff tensions, Ukrainian President Zelensky endorsed US tariffs on nations dealing with Russia, despite Ukraine's reliance on Indian-refined Russian oil. White House trade advisor Peter Navarro criticized India's oil purchases, prompting backlash and accusations of anti-BRICS rhetoric.

title: India, China should counter unfair U.S. tariffs: Chinese envoy
description: Xu Feihong said the U.S. is using the tariffs as a kind of “weapon” to extract “exorbitant” costs from various countries, and India and China must cooperate with each other to navigate the situation

description: At present, the products are levied VAT/sales tax by State governments and the rates vary

title: After Nizam, successive Congress govts ensured drinking water supply for Hyderabad, says CM Revanth Reddy
description: Foundation laid for Godavari Phase II & III at Gandipet to bring additional 17.5 tmc ft of water to Hyderabad, rejuvenate the Musi river and meet the city’s rising drinking water needs by 2027

title: GST 2.0 could undermine dietary health
description: While policymakers have framed GST 2.0 as being more rational, a public health lens suggests affordability gains could bypass the goal of healthier consumption

description: In a fierce gunfight in Kulgam, south Kashmir, Subedar Perbhat Gaur and Lance Naik Narender Sindhu of the Indian Army were killed, raising the year's security toll in J&K to 19. The clash, initiated by a joint search operation in Guddar forests, resulted in the death of two terrorists, one suspected to be a Pakistani national.

title: Hazratbal row: Omar seeks apology from waqf chair Andrabi
description: Following the installation of a plaque with the National Emblem at Hazratbal shrine, political tensions rise in Jammu and Kashmir. Omar Abdullah criticizes the Waqf Board, while Mehbooba Mufti demands an FIR against its chairperson.

title: J&K's AAP MLA Malik jailed under PSA; political parties decry action
description: Mehraj Malik, AAP's J&K unit chief, was detained under the Public Safety Act amid protests by government employees who accused him of abusing the Doda DC. This action has sparked condemnation from political parties, including Omar Abdullah, who called it an assault on democracy.

title: Taylor Swift skips NFL opener: security, album promo; Kelce plays solo
description: Travis Kelce's season opener in Brazil against the Chargers saw a notable absence: Taylor Swift. Despite recent engagement buzz, logistical challenges, including security and travel costs, kept Swift away. No other Chiefs' partners made the trip either. Brazilian fans, anticipating her arrival based on local media reports, still showed their support, hoping to see her at future games.

description: Alphabet's shares surged after a federal judge's ruling in its antitrust case avoided severe penalties like the forced divestiture of Chrome and Android. This decision boosted not only Alphabet's market cap by over $230 billion but also positively impacted Apple, allowing their lucrative search engine agreement to continue.

title: Rohit Sharma spotted at hospital late night, leaves fans worried - Watch
description: Concerns arose among fans after Rohit Sharma's recent hospital visit, though he had cleared a fitness test in Bengaluru. Having been absent since the 2025 Champions Trophy win, Sharma, along with Virat Kohli, is set to return for the ODI series against Australia.

Tesla's FSD program faces legal scrutiny and safety concerns despite expanding robotaxi operations.
